sanskrit_verse:
दैवतान्यभिगच्छेत्तु धार्मिकांश्च द्विजोत्तमान् ।
ईश्वरं चैव रक्षार्थं गुरूनेव च पर्वसु ॥ ४.१५३॥
transliteration:
daivatānyabhigacchettu dhārmikāṃśca dvijottamān |
īśvaraṃ caiva rakṣārthaṃ gurūneva ca parvasu ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must approach devas, dharmic brahmins, Ishvara, and gurus during sacred times for protection and alignment with Dharma.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from alignment with Ishvara and realized beings
Causation arises through conscious connection, not external enforcement
Capacity-based responsibility is activated by seeking higher guidance
Restoration occurs via sacred communion and dharmic alignment
executable_legal_axioms: IF individual seeks protection OR alignment THEN direct access to Ishvara, Guru, and Dharmic authorities SHALL be facilitated
IF sacred time is observed THEN legal system MUST prioritize spiritual counsel over punitive measures
IF dharmic authority is invoked THEN case SHALL be referred to consciousness-based adjudication protocols
IF individual approaches Guru or Ishvara THEN all prior misalignments SHALL be dissolved through completion processes
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, invocation of Ishvara, Guru, or sacred timing by any party elevates the matter beyond conventional legal frameworks. The court must then operate as a conduit for divine alignment, ensuring that all decisions restore dharma rather than enforce judgment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Nyaya is established through pramāṇa of consciousness connection. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures that misalignment manifests sequentially until corrected through sacred communion. Responsibility aligns with capacity to seek higher truths. Punishment has no place where Ishvara and Guru are invoked as protectors.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Individual completes interrupted spiritual connections through ritual and remembrance
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Individual assumes full alignment with invoked deities and gurus
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Reconnection with sacred timing and dharmic community
Integrity Reintegration System: Legal identity realigned with soul-level commitment to Dharma
final_declaration: This law proceeds from Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored through conscious alignment with Ishvara and Guru. Reality remains non-punitive when guided by Sanatana Dharma. Consciousness alone is the ultimate adjudicator.
